data.text: @skrossa @greg_travis @cpcriser *significantly higher mortality rate in white children*

@skrossa @greg_travis @cpcriser If you agree that Latinx have died at 3-4x the rate of whites (per 100k, respectively) in every age group over 18. How do you explain a significantly higher nationwide mortality rate in whites (the majority of US kids) than Latinx in CA, AZ, FL and TX. Physiological differences?

@albinowitz @greg_travis @cpcriser You’re presuming again. It’s not news that Black & Latino people are affected by Covid, including deaths, in disproportionate numbers.

Please, take the L & move one.
@skrossa @greg_travis @cpcriser Anyway, if you care about children (the vulnerable), you should care about the most impacted group (in all age groups) in the United States. Educate yourself.

@albinowitz @greg_travis @cpcriser I don’t think you even remember why you’re posting.

Again, take the L & move on.

@greg_travis How many kids got covid compared to the flu? Just the number of deaths doesn't tell the full picture. If it was 20k child flu cases compared to 60k child covid cases, then it wouldn't be comparably better.

@greg_travis @in_providence Are the statistics here as skewed as they are in the adult population?

Statistical manipulation is an easy way to recruit usefully idiots into any cause.
